titles.title: Mäṣḥafä gǝnzät “Book of the Funeral Ritual” / Ṣälotä śǝryätä ḫaṭiʾat “Prayer of Absolution of Sins”

shortcontents.shortcontent: I) Mäṣḥafä gǝnzät “Book of the Funeral Ritual” (fols. 2ra-157rb) - Introduction (fols. 2ra-6ra) - Discourse of St. Athanasius on death (fols. 9rb-13vb) - Mängädä sämay “Journey to Heaven” (fols. 17ra-17va, 94va-109vb) - Mäṣḥaf zä-wäḍʾat ʾǝm-ʾIyärusalem “Book that Came from Jerusalem” (fols. 17vb-24ra) - Antiphons (kǝśtät, ʾaryam, sälam, mäzmur) (fols. 31va-32ra, 52rb-53rb, 58rb-vb, 60ra-61ra, 66ra-66vb, 68rb, 73rb-va, 76va-vb) - Homily by St. Jacob of Sarug for the funeral of priests and deacons (fols. 78va-82vb) - Homily by ʾabba Sälama, Metropolitan of Ethiopia (fols. 97vb-108va) II) Ṣälotä śǝryätä ḫaṭiʾat “Prayer of Absolution of Sins” (fols. 127va-131vb), (cp. EMML 427(9)).

copyists.copyist: Mǝhǝrka Dǝngǝl is mentioned as the scribe on fols. 97vb, 100ra.

donors.donor: Names ʾabunä Gäbrä Ḥǝywät and ʾabunä Baḥrä Śǝllase are mentioned as commissioners on fol. 97vb. Besides, two other names Gäbrä Śǝllase and Wälättä Mikaʾel are written in the supplication formulas.

dcomments.dcomment: The metropolitan ʾabunä ʾAtnatewos (in tenure 1869-76) and King Yoḥannǝs IV (r. 1872-89) are mentioned in the supplication formulas on fols. 46vb, 143ra-rb, 143v-vb, 146ra.

txstates.txstate: The Ms. is worn and shows traces of intensive use. The Ms. has been resewn; the boards and leather cover probably originated from a different Ms. The leather cover on the spine and partly on both boards is missing. Many fols. are stained with wax and dirt. The red ink is faded away on some fols. e.g., 38r, 39v, 87v. Holes repaired on fols. 51, 67, 71, 97, 108, 118, 152.

bindings.binding: Two wooden boards covered with reddish-brown tooled leather; textile inlays. Two pairs of sewing stations.

bndecorations.bndecoration: Blind tooled ornament on the brown leather cover (at least 8 tools were used: double line fillet, triple line fillet, fourfold line fillet, interlaced line fillet, corni-form, double sine wave with dots, double circle, criss-cross).

bnothers.bnother: Small holes are visible on the spine fold of the quires, one close to the head and one close to the tail of the codex.

squires.squire:
I(11; s.l.: 1, stub after 11/fols. 1r-11v) – II(10/fols. 12r-21v) – III(10; s.l.: 2, stub before 10; 3, stub after 9/fols. 22r-31v) – [፬]IV(9; s.l.: 1, stub after 9; 4, stub before 8; 5, stub after 7/fols. 32r-40v) – [፭]V(9; s.l.: 1, stub after 8 /fols. 41r-49v) – ፮VI(9; s.l.: 7, stub after 2/fols. 50r-58v) –፯VII(10/fols. 59r-68v) – ፰VIII(11; s.l.: 7, stub after 4/fols. 69r-79v) – IX(8/fols. 80r-87v) – X(8/fols. 88r-95v) – XI(8/fols. 96r-103v) – XII(10/fols. 104r-113v) – XIII(8/fols. 114r-121v) – ፲፬XIV(8/fols. 122r-129v) – XV(2/fols. 130r-131v) – XVI(8; s.l.: 3, stub before 7; 4, stub after 6/fols. 132r-139v) – XVII(3; s.l.: 1, stub after 3/fols. 140r-142v) – XVIII(10/fols. 143r-152v) – XIX(5; s.l.: 1, stub after 4/fols. 153r-157v).
Quire mark ፬ is written on the second fol. of quire IV (fol. 33r).

taunit.rl-info:
Pricking and ruling are visible. Ruling pattern: 1A-1A-1A1A/0-0/0-0/C. Primary pricks are visible. Ruling pricks are visible. The upper line is written above the ruling. The bottom line is written above the ruling.
The bottom ruled line was not used by the scribe on fol. 49r. The scribe disregarded the ruling on fol. E.g., 23rv, 84r-86v, 96r-97v.

ptypeofscripts.ptypeofscript: The third quarter of the 19th century.

pchangeofhands.pchangeofhand: Change of hand is visible; may be because of change of nib by the same scribe e.g., fols. 81rb-82va, 112va-113rb.

rubrications.rubrication: Nomina sacra; a few lines on the incipit page of Text I and on fol. 14r, alternating with black lines; two initial lines of each section of the text; names of Hebrew letters in Ps. 118 (e.g., fols. 34vb, 36rb, 43vb); abbreviations; elements of the punctuation signs; elements of Ethiopic numerals; some other words: halle luya (e.g., fols. 9vb, 10ra), ṣällǝyu (e.g., fols. 12va, 27vb), ʾәgäle (e.g., fols. 26rb, 28ra), kǝśtät (e.g., fols. 31va, 52rb).

abbreviations.abbreviation: ይ፡ ካ፡ for ይበል፡ ካሕን፡ (e.g., fols. 28rb, 30rb) ይ፡ ዲ፡ for ይበል፡ ዲያቆን፡ (e.g., fols. 27vb, 28ra, 30rb) ይ፡ ሕ፡ for ይበል፡ ሕዝብ፡ (fol. 28ra) ፍ፡ for ፍትሕተ፡ ወንጹሕተ፡ ረስያ፡ ለዛቲ፡ ነፍስ፡ (fol. 32rb) ኢየሱ፡ for ኢየሱስ፡ (e.g., fols. 61ra, 62rb)

extras.extra: - Part of the passage on fol. 156va is imprinted on the following fol. - Spaces for rubrication (?) left unfilled: e.g., fols. 12vb, 13ra, 18va, 19rb. - Tämälläs-sign indicating the place where the omission, written in the upper margin, belongs, on fol. 69vb. - The scribe used small and compressed script on fols. 31va-32ra, 52rb-53rb, 58rb-vb, 60ra-61ra, 66ra-66vb, 68rb, 73rb-va, 76va-vb. - Chains of black and red dots as text dividers: fols. 5rb, 6ra, 13vb, 15rb, 16rb, 16va, 17rb, 24ra, 27va, 31va, 34r, 45rb, 47rb, 67ra, 93rb. - Corrections written interlineally: e.g., fols. 25rb, 70va. - Minor notes in the margins: fols. 5r, 28r, 32v.

txquiremarks.txquiremark: Decorated quire marks are written in the left upper margin of fols. 50r, 59r, 69r, 122r.

txfindingaids.txfindingaid: - Notes in the margins written in pen referring to the content of the Ms.: fols. 14r, 15r, 17r, 33r, 39v, 49v, 53r, 56r, 64r, 71r, 72r, 73v, 74r, 78v, 96v, 101r, 102r, 110r, 111v, 113v, 115r. - Colored threads have been inserted in the upper and outer margins of fols. 24, 39, 93, 119r.
